  606. The product works just fine, but the instructions are not correct.<br /><br />Molding the mouthpieces was fine, the instructions are adequate here. The first issue is that the instructions say to apply 0.5cc to each tray, which they say is equivalent to a small drop. This isn't true. 0.5cc = 0.5mL, and the 0.5mL markings are on each syringe. When you dispense that amount, it's much more than one small drop.<br /><br />The instructions also say that you can do a whitening treatment every day. For me, this was absolutely incorrect.<br /><br />On day one, the treatment went the way it's supposed to. My gums were a little sore, but nothing much really. On day two, I tried to do another treatment and my gums were absolutely burning. It was very painful, I had to take the trays out of my mouth after about two minutes. My gums were visibly inflamed. Not surprisingly, they looked white as though they were being bleached (because they were). It was painful but my gums stopped hurting after a couple hours. Then I waited about 5 days and did another treatment, which went basically they way it should.<br /><br />In summary, my experience was that I have to wait about a week between treatments. Trying to do them any more frequently is very painful and likely terrible for my gums. Also, as a tip, make sure your head is tilted back when you put the trays in your mouth. I started salivating excessively as soon as I got them in. If you do this all correctly though, the results are good and you will have nicely whitened teeth.

It had turned into a palish pink color. I wanted to cry. Luckily the color did change back. After that I use not too much but not too little. Every time I use the gel I can feel it bubbling but after the time is up and I remove the trays my teeth are the same. No changes. I've used the product every other day because I was afraid of sensitivity but I didn't have that problem. The product did nothing for me. I repeated the process for 16 days (box says between 15 and 30) and for once I was happy a product hadn't lied to me! My teeth were whiter, brighter, and didn't stain nearly as easily afterwards. I absolutely recommend this to anyone who has been having problems with the popular brands that just don't do their jobs.

  747. I am obsessed with having white teeth, as I am a compulsive perfectionist! So I am always on the lookout for teeth whitening products that are safe and won't strip the enamel or have any annoying side effects. So in the Shine Whitening kit you get 2 5cc syringes, whitening gel, plus top and bottom mouth trays. I followed the directions and put a small drop on the outsides of the arch part in the tray, then i spread it with the syringe. I repeated this for the bottom tray and put the trays in my mouth for 15 minutes (I set my timer). I was very satisfied with the results! There is a chart that comes with the kit, (this chart is really cool!) you hold the chart to the mirror while flashing a smile to see your before and after shade, there are number letter combinations and you pick the one that fits your shade. For example I went from a C2 to a B1! My husband was so impressed he has purchased a kit! With this kit I didn't experience sensitivity from the gel, which was awsome because I have in the past. I think Shine Whitening does not have the sensitivity due to the fact that the gel is applied to the outside layers of the trays, and so the gel never touches your gums. It removes the stains from the outside, yet it is very effective, I am a coffee addict and you could never tell! The results lasted me for around a month and 2 weeks, but everyone is different but It will at least last a month, I mean the results are amazing! Like I said I am an around the clock coffee drinker and The kit withstood the coffee for a month and 2 weeks! This is good for smokers too! I paid a visit to my dentist 2 weeks after my treatment wore off and I was not tormented with sensitive gums and was able to get an A+ on my exam! So overall the Shine Whitening kit doesn't leave any nasty side effects, like the buildup and sensitivity some gels cause, lasts at least a month and is ideal for regular coffee drinkers and smokers, and the results made my teeth 4 shades lighter according to the chart that comes with the kit.   759. This is definitely a fake product. DO NOT BUY<br /><br />As people here pointed out, I came across this product from a review for Crest 3D, I said why not give a try? I understand most the of concerns that the reviews are fake and paid by the seller, so I this review will be updated daily. This is my first day of using it. ( 06/20/2014) I started suing it on Friday and on Monday of the same week I already had my 6-month cleaning done at my dentist's, I use an electric brush, floss, and rinse twice a day. I have 11 fillings and two crowns, so you will get to know a lot about this product from this review :)<br />****First day ( 06/20/2014)****<br />1- Let me tell you I couldn't find an FDA approval anywhere on the product which could signal a bad sign,<br />2- I started my day as usual brushing my teeth and using the rinse afterwards. I didn't eat anything till noon. I told my self try to use the product just before lunch.<br />3- Before I use it I read the questions on Amazon carefully and how to use the trays. Once you put them in hot water they become very flexible and floppy! Don't submerge them over a minute or they will shrink! As a matter of fact I had of them shrunk by 2 mm from both ends compared to the other tray. Once the trays are floppy, put them on your teeth and make sure you press hard around the circular part of the try to make them mold and take the shape of your teeth. I can say this part was a bit tricky as you get only one chance to mold the piece to your teeth or you will have to buy another tray. I did this successfully and the tray really fit my teeth in an amazing way. After the successful completion of this step, you can apply the gel to the tray.<br />4- I applied a very small amount of gel (5 mm or less) then put the tray on my teeth for 10 minutes , I couldn't put it for more than that because the gel started to burn one part of my gums. I don't say burn all my gums but it whitened and burned a small line above one of my teeth. I brushed afterwards and the white line was gone after 2 hours.<br />5- As a matter of fact I didn't eat after using the product for 3 hours, but the gel is really refreshing<br />5- I looked at the mirror and I can say there is a small difference after the first day for sure.<br />6 I can attest to the fact that your gum will be bothering you for the first 5 hours after first use. ( first day experience but don't know if this will last for the coming days or not)<br />7- The 2 syringes that comes with this product have 50 mm of gel so you can do 10 treatments as recommended by the seller.<br /><br />****Second day ( 06/21/2014)****<br />1- It has been more than 20 hours since I did my first treatment<br />2- I looked at their website where I found a video that shows how to mold the trays correctly. The one explaining that in the vides asserts that you will be able to mold it again once you heat it. I tried but in vain since the tray has already shrunk and some ends folded onto itself. This confirms my experience that you have only one shot to mold the trays.<br />3- Used the gel as yesterday, now I can say I can feel burns around my gums. I can see 5 white lines beneath my teeth in the lower part.<br /><br />****Third day (06/22/2014)******<br />1- I am maintaining my daily habits. Used less gel today to overcome sensitivity. The sensitivty usually goes after 24 hours.<br /><br />***Forth Day (06/23/2014)*******<br />1- Used my water-pik today and my gums couldn't handle it, so I decided I am not going to use the product today<br /><br />***Fifth day (07/24/2014)********<br />I didn't use it to help cure my sensitivity.<br /><br />**7th day (06/25/2014)*****<br />There is no more sensitivity in my gums so I started using it again it but turns out that how little gel you use you still burn your gums. Tomorrow I will try to apply the gel directly to my teeth instead of the tray and I will report on the results.<br /><br />** last day day *****<br />I stopped using it all together as I noticed that my gums started to recede !I can see more and more of my teeth each time I use it. This is definitely a fake product. DO NOT BUY

  772. Just finished using this product, I thought I would write a detailed review about it:<br /><br />First off, the box comes in a simple clear packaging, with a short list of instructions, and which also points you to a more advanced video on their website (which I would suggest using so that you get the best fit for your mouthpiece). Inside the box, you get two tubes of the carbamide peroxide teeth whitening gel + mouthpiece, which is actually a lot because you honestly don't need much… I have a lot left over.<br /><br />One thing I would say is you really want to focus on using as little of the gel as possible. Think of how much you might need, and then use half of that amount. If you use too much, the gel will spill out of the mouthpiece and irritate your gums.<br /><br />I personally didn't have a problem with the strength of the gel, but everybody has a different set of teeth. If you have sensitive teeth, don't use the gel for too long at one time as this type of whitening (well, any kind of whitening), will make your teeth more sensitive than usual. If you are finding its too sensitive, use it every other day instead of every day. It will increase the time it takes to get your teeth white, but I would rather wait a little longer, than have sensitive teeth every day.<br /><br />Overall this product seems like pretty good value, it seems like its a fairly high quality product. After my results (I at least gained 2 shades which is amazing), i figure that Ill buy a couple more sets of these and buying it for the rest of my family. We drink so much coffee that our teeth just aren't as white as they should be.

  938. The bare-bones package contains two plastic bite trays and two syringes of whitener. There are no detailed instructions inside, only a few steps on the back. The packaging says \\"Please visit shinewhitening.com for an easy-to-follow instructional video on how to use the mouth trays\\". I went to the website and...no video. Fortunately I found a series of videos by a dentist named Joel Terry Alford (search his full name on youtube) that did an excellent job of explaining how to correctly form the trays and how to correctly apply the whitener. On my first time using the trays I used a bit too much on top and my gums turned white in one spot. Gum oxidation is common when whitening teeth and the white spots go away after about 15 minutes or so. I removed the tray, wiped my gum clean, and wiped the tray in that spot and continued whitening with no further issues. After whitening I rinsed well with cold water and \\"buffed\\" my teeth with a towel. The product works best if you have a good set of trays. I recommend when you make them to scratch a \\"T\\" on the side of one so you can easily tell which is for the top and bottom.<br /><br />UPDATE: I have reduced my rating for this product. I did the full 10 day treatment with the gel and my final conclusion is that it is just OK. It did not whiten as much as I expected, although the gel was certainly strong as it oxidized/burned my gums where it leaked out of the trays. After I finished with this product I started using whitening strips once per day for another 10 days or so and, to top it off, I brushed with Crest 3D whitening toothpaste every other day. The final result was noticeable whitening from the combination of products, BUT if I had to do it over I would NOT buy this product again.<br /><br />And yes there are many fake reviews for this product. I have taken an extra star off my rating to reflect that the makers of this product engage in deceptive practices.
  939. Great value! I got pkg 2 day, max 3 after ordering. Very happy with value. I didn't want to pay $500 for dentist version, plus $80/year after. I used for 10 days as directed, and dentist used \\"tint\\" measuring electronic tool, and said I moved 4 shades lighter, about what their process would have done. That for less $35 per year (sufficient for 2 application cycles of 10 days each). Very happy with product. PS I understand they use the same chemical and strength of chemical as dentists. The difference is the dentist fits the mouthguard to your teeth. This at home version, you spend about 20 min. or less the first time heating guard and pressing it to your teeth shape.

The strips are easier to put on, but these worked well as they fit my mouth after heating them up.<br /><br />- The gel itself had very little taste to it, a slight taste of mint that was not bad. I’ve read a lot of the reviews, most saying it was fine, but some saying their gums burned, so I’ve opted to use as little as possible and try to put it only on the sections of the trays that are exposed to my teeth. It took a little time to do this, but I’m pleased to report that my gums have not had any pain after 7 treatments.<br /><br />- The best thing about this product is that the results are noticeable after the first treatment, and I’ve continually getting good results from it. That said, after my 7th treatment I can’t really tell if it’s getting whiter, so I’ve stopped using it. If my teeth start to get yellow again, I’ll use this product to pick it back up.<br /><br />In summation, the product works, it’s a little cumbersome to setup, but I’m happy with it overall.
